      • isSkipActionGraphCache

        @Value.Derived
public boolean isSkipActionGraphCache()
        Returns:
        whether the current invocation of Buck should skip the Action Graph cache, leaving the cached Action Graph in memory for the next request and creating a fresh Action Graph for the current request (which will be garbage-collected when the current request is complete). Commonly, a one-off request, like from a linter, will specify this option so that it does not invalidate the primary in-memory Action Graph that the user is likely relying on for fast iterative builds.
